## Classes

### artifactory

Class: artifactory

This module downloads Artifacts from Artifactory

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
class { artifactory :
  endpoint => 'https://repo.jfrog.org/artifactory',
}
```

##### 

```puppet
class { artifactory :
  endpoint => 'https://repo.jfrog.org/artifactory',
  api_key  => 'xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx',
}
```

##### 

```puppet
class { artifactory :
  endpoint => 'https://repo.jfrog.org/artifactory',
  username => 'myuserid',
  password => 'secretpassword',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `artifactory` class.

##### `endpoint`

Data type: `Stdlib::HTTPUrl`

The endpoint for the Artifactory server. If you are running the "default"
Artifactory installation using tomcat, don't forget to include the
+/artifactoy+ part of the URL.

##### `username`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The username used to authenticate to the Artifactory server.

##### `password`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The password used to authenticate to the Artifactory server.
Since this uses HTTP Basic Auth, it is highly recommended that you run Artifactory over SSL.

##### `api_key`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The API key used to authenticate to the Artifactory server.
You can also use an API key for authentication.
username and password take precedence so leave them off if you are using an API key.

## Defined types

### artifactory::artifact

This defined type allows to specify an artifact that should be searched in and downloaded from artifactory.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
artifactory::artifact {'myartifact':
  group_id    => 'org.artifactory',
  artifact_id => 'artifactory-api',
  version     => '',
  repository  => 'oss-releases-local',
  output      => "/tmp/",
  extension   => 'jar',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `artifactory::artifact` defined type.

##### `output`

Data type: `String`

The target file name or folder to store the artifact in.

##### `group_id`

Data type: `String`

the Maven group id to search for

##### `artifact_id`

Data type: `String`

the Maven artifact id to search for

Default value: $title

##### `version`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

the Maven version of the artifact to search for

Default value: ''

##### `repository`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

the list of repos to search

Default value: ''

##### `extension`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

the file extension to search

Default value: 'jar'

##### `classifier`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

the classifer to search for

Default value: `undef`

##### `ensure`

Data type: `String`

Whether of the artifact should exist at the target location or not and weather it should be updated.

Default value: present

##### `owner`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The user which should own the artifact file. Argument can be a user name or a user ID.
This value will be passed to the owner attribute of a Puppet file resource.

Default value: `undef`

##### `group`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The group which should own the artifact file. Argument can be either a group name or a group ID.
This value will be passed to the group attribute of a Puppet file resource.

Default value: `undef`

##### `mode`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The desired permissions mode for the artifact file, in symbolic or numeric notation.
This value will be passed to the mode attribute of a Puppet file resource.

Default value: `undef`

## Functions

### config_endpoint

Type: Ruby 4.x API

Initializes the Artifactory Client with the given parameters

#### `config_endpoint(String $endpoint, String $api_key)`

The config_endpoint function.

Returns: `Any`

##### `endpoint`

Data type: `String`

The endpoint for the Artifactory server. If you are running the "default"
Artifactory installation using tomcat, don't forget to include the
+/artifactoy+ part of the URL.

##### `api_key`

Data type: `String`

The API key used to authenticate to the Artifactory server.
You can also use an API key for authentication.
username and password take precedence so leave them off if you are using an API key.

#### `config_endpoint(String $endpoint, String $username, String $password)`

The config_endpoint function.

Returns: `Any`

##### `endpoint`

Data type: `String`

The endpoint for the Artifactory server. If you are running the "default"
Artifactory installation using tomcat, don't forget to include the
+/artifactoy+ part of the URL.

##### `username`

Data type: `String`

The username used to authenticate to the Artifactory server.

##### `password`

Data type: `String`

The password used to authenticate to the Artifactory server.
Since this uses HTTP Basic Auth, it is highly recommended that you run Artifactory over SSL.

#### `config_endpoint(String $endpoint)`

The config_endpoint function.

Returns: `Any`

##### `endpoint`

Data type: `String`

The endpoint for the Artifactory server. If you are running the "default"
Artifactory installation using tomcat, don't forget to include the
+/artifactoy+ part of the URL.

### get_artifact_info

Type: Ruby 4.x API

Search for an artifact in Artifactory by Maven coordinates: +Group ID+, +Artifact ID+,
+Version+ and +Classifier+.

#### `get_artifact_info(String $group_id, String $artifact_id, String $version, String $repository, String $extension)`

The get_artifact_info function.

Returns: `Hash` Will return an Hash containing two values `return_value['download_uri']` and `return_value['filename']`.
```ruby
return_value['download_uri']  # URI to download the artifact
return_value['download_uri']  # filename of the artifact to download
```

##### `group_id`

Data type: `String`

the Maven group id to search for

##### `artifact_id`

Data type: `String`

the Maven artifact id to search for

##### `version`

Data type: `String`

the Maven version of the artifact to search for

##### `repository`

Data type: `String`

the list of repos to search

##### `extension`

Data type: `String`

the file extension to search
